questions.question: Which microorganism(s) among the following perform photosynthesis by utilizing light?
options: More than one of the above
questions.answer: More than one of the above
questions.solution: Both Algae and Cyanobacteria perform photosynthesis using light.

questions.question: What is the approximate size of the bacterial cell?
questions.solution: Bacterial cells typically range from 0.5 to 1.0 micrometers in diameter.

questions.question: Microorganisms are used during which stage of the purification of the sewage water?
questions.solution: Microorganisms play a key role in the secondary treatment of sewage, where they help break down organic matter.

questions.question: The maximum concentration of alcohol in beverages that are naturally fermented is:
questions.solution: Naturally fermented beverages typically reach an alcohol concentration of 10 - 15% before fermentation stops.

questions.question: Big holes in Swiss cheese are made by:
options: a bacterium that produces methane gas
a bacterium producing a large amount of carbon dioxide
a fungus that releases a lot of gases during its metabolic activities
questions.answer: a bacterium producing a large amount of carbon dioxide
questions.solution: Propionibacterium, a bacterium, produces carbon dioxide gas during fermentation, which forms the characteristic holes in Swiss cheese.

questions.question: The vitamin whose content increases following the conversion of milk into curd by lactic acid bacteria is:
questions.solution: The fermentation process by lactic acid bacteria increases the vitamin B12 content in curd.

questions.question: Which one of the following alcoholic drinks is produced without distillation?
questions.solution: Wine is produced by fermentation without the process of distillation.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a bacterial disease?
questions.solution: Typhoid is caused by the bacterium Salmonella typhi.

questions.question: Tiny black rounded structure found on spoiled bread pieces are:
questions.solution: The black rounded structures are sporangia of fungi, typically Rhizopus, commonly known as bread mold.

questions.question: Which is/are not correct regarding microorganisms?
options: Microorganisms can be seen by naked eyes.
Microorganisms are classified into four major groups.
Fungi are one type of microorganism.
The virus is a special type of microorganism compared to the other three types.
questions.solution: Microorganisms are too small to be seen by the naked eye, and this statement is incorrect.

questions.question: Antibiotics are generally produced from:
questions.solution: Antibiotics are commonly produced from fungi and bacteria.

questions.question: A common preservative used in jam and pickles is:
options: More than one of the above
questions.answer: More than one of the above
questions.solution: Both Sodium benzoate and Acetic acid are commonly used as preservatives in jams and pickles.

questions.question: Pasteurised milk is heated to about what temperature for 15 to 30 seconds and then suddenly chilled and stored?
questions.solution: Pasteurization involves heating milk to around 70°C for 15 to 30 seconds before rapid cooling.

questions.question: Which of the following present in the soil fix nitrogen from the atmosphere and convert it into compounds of nitrogen?
options: More than one of the above
questions.answer: More than one of the above
questions.solution: Both bacteria (such as Rhizobium) and blue-green algae (cyanobacteria) fix nitrogen from the atmosphere.

questions.question: Which of the following is not used as food preservatives?
questions.solution: Methane is not used as a food preservative; salt, sugar, and vinegar are commonly used preservatives.

questions.question: What helps in the rise of bread or dosa dough?
questions.solution: The rise of dough is due to the carbon dioxide produced by the growth of yeast cells.

questions.question: The status of algae in the aquatic food chain is:
questions.solution: Algae are producers in the aquatic food chain, as they produce food through photosynthesis.

questions.question: Antibiotics are effective against:
options: More than one of the above
questions.solution: Antibiotics are primarily effective against bacteria, not viruses or algae.

questions.question: The algae commonly used as a fertilizer are:
questions.solution: Blue-green algae (cyanobacteria) are commonly used as a bio-fertilizer due to their nitrogen-fixing capabilities.

questions.question: A group of microorganisms that have the characters of both living and non-living are:
questions.solution: Viruses exhibit characteristics of both living and non-living entities; they are inactive outside a host but can replicate inside one.
